Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Non-specific lipid-transfer protein 3 (LTP 3; CW-19; CW-20; Plants)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the plant LTP family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Fusarim solani (EC50=3-20×10-6 M), Pseudomonas solanacearum (EC50=3-6×10-7 M), Pythium aphanidermatum, Clavibacter michiganensis subsp. Sepedonicus (EC50=l-3×10-7 M).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Plant non-specific lipid-transfer proteins transfer phospholipids as well as galactolipids across membranes. May play a role in wax or cutin deposition in the cell walls of expanding epidermal cells and certain secretory tissues.

Literature.Title: Lipid transfer proteins (nsLTPs) from barley and maize leaves are potent inhibitors of bacterial and fungal plant pathogens.
Literature.Author: Molina A, Segura A, García-Olmedo F.

Literature.Title: Developmental and pathogen-induced expression of three barley genes encoding lipid transfer proteins.
Literature.Author: Molina A, Garc­a-Olmedo F.
